claim: World of Warcraft is heavier than a loaf of bread.

supporting.text: World of Warcraft is a digital game with no physical mass, while a loaf of bread has measurable weight.

attacks.text: World of Warcraft is a digital game with no physical mass, while a loaf of bread has measurable weight.
The claim may refer to the physical weight of game discs or packaging, which could exceed that of a loaf of bread.
Even with packaging, the weight of a single game disc is typically less than 100 grams, while a loaf of bread often weighs 400-500 grams.
The claim could metaphorically refer to the cultural or economic 'weight' of World of Warcraft compared to bread.
Metaphorical interpretations are irrelevant to the literal comparison of physical weight implied by the claim.

supporting.text: The weight of a loaf of bread typically ranges from 400 to 800 grams, whereas software like World of Warcraft has no mass.

attacks.text: The weight of a loaf of bread typically ranges from 400 to 800 grams, whereas software like World of Warcraft has no mass.
Physical copies of World of Warcraft, such as installation discs, have mass and can be heavier than a loaf of bread.
Modern distribution of World of Warcraft is primarily digital, making physical copies irrelevant to the comparison.
The hardware required to run World of Warcraft (e.g., a gaming PC) has significant mass, indirectly contributing to its 'weight'.
The hardware is not part of the software itself, so it doesn't make sense to include it in the weight comparison.

supporting.text: Physical objects like bread can be weighed on a scale, but virtual games cannot be measured in the same way.

attacks.text: Physical objects like bread can be weighed on a scale, but virtual games cannot be measured in the same way.
The claim is metaphorical, comparing the 'weight' of engagement or impact, not physical mass.
Metaphorical interpretations are subjective and not universally accepted as valid comparisons.
Virtual games have physical components (e.g., servers, devices) that can be weighed collectively.
The physical components are not the game itself but the infrastructure supporting it.

supporting.text: Mass is a property of matter, and World of Warcraft, being software, does not consist of matter.

attacks.text: Mass is a property of matter, and World of Warcraft, being software, does not consist of matter.
While software itself is immaterial, the physical media (e.g., hard drives, servers) required to store and run World of Warcraft have mass.
The mass of physical media is negligible compared to a loaf of bread, and the claim refers to the software itself, not its storage.
The claim is ambiguous—it could refer to the total infrastructure supporting World of Warcraft, which would far exceed a loaf of bread in mass.
